historicSites.Name: Mount Kailash
historicSites.Description: A sacred mountain in Tibet, revered in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Bon religions. Considered the abode of Lord Shiva.

historicSites.Name: Petra
historicSites.Description: Ancient city carved into rose-colored rock faces, featuring elaborate temples and tombs.

historicSites.Name: Hang Son Doong
historicSites.Description: The largest cave in the world, located in the heart of the Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park.

historicSites.Name: Great Pyramid of Giza
historicSites.Description: The oldest and largest of the three pyramids in Giza, and the last remaining wonder of the ancient world.

historicSites.Name: Aladaglar Mountains
historicSites.Description: A stunning mountain range known for its rugged beauty, with religious significance in Zoroastrianism.

historicSites.Name: Sri Ranganatha Swamy Temple
historicSites.Description: One of the largest temple complexes in India, dedicated to Lord Ranganatha, a form of the Hindu god Vishnu.

historicSites.Name: Machu Picchu
historicSites.Description: An ancient Incan city located high in the Andes Mountains, known for its sophisticated dry-stone construction.

historicSites.Name: Stonehenge
historicSites.Description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones, believed to have been used for ceremonial or religious purposes.

historicSites.Name: Lalibela Churches
historicSites.Description: A group of rock-hewn churches carved into the mountains, considered one of Ethiopia's holiest sites.

historicSites.Name: Chichen Itza
historicSites.Description: A large pre-Columbian archaeological site, once a major focal point of the Maya civilization.
